titles.title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to give certain rights to Department of Defense employees with respect to actions or determinations under Office of Management and Budget Circular A-76.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Armed Services, and in addition to the Committees on the Judiciary, and Government Reform, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Readiness.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Technology and Procurement Policy.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Commercial and Administrative Law.

bill.summary: 6/19/2001--Introduced. Deems a recognized labor organization representing Department of Defense employees to be an interested party having appeal rights concerning any action or determination made under any comparison conducted by the Department of Defense under Office of Management and Budget Circular A-76 of the cost of performing commercial activities by Department of Defense personnel and the cost of performing such activities by contractor personnel.
